item.title: Goals
item.description: A place for me to just talk off the cuff about my personal goals and plans. At the moment it’s a little empty, but this is helpful as I begin to really dig into what I’m interested in.

item.title: Japanese
item.description: This is my main page for collecting resources and planning my Japanese journey Resources § Transclude of block japanese.

item.title: Linguistics
item.description: I am fascinated by language and the ways they evolve and the forms they take. While I mainly want to study linguistics in order to better help me learn Japanese, I would love to develop a conlang or two with it.

item.title: Absolute Values in Algebra
item.description: Absolute values in algebra is a bit weird but aside from some specific rules they’re pretty fun to solve. First off, you cannot change the inside signs of an absolute value.

item.title: Big Unorganized Math Notes
item.description: Turns out making specific pages for each note has been bad for me actually making notes, so here I’m just gonna spam all the notes without much explaining.

item.title: Completing The Square
item.description: Sometimes it’s easier to modify an equation so it becomes a full quadradic equation. Take the following: As it is this is not factorable, and while you can use quadratic method instead, you can force it to be factorable! You can do this whenever the b term is even, this will not work if b term is odd.

item.title: Math Index
item.description: These are going to be all of my notes on math, ones that work specifically for me but may work for you Links § GeoGebra Great site to graph and export graphs to SVG.

item.title: Shortcuts
item.description: This is where I’ll have various shortcuts. Quickly Foil § If you have something like this Missing \begin{align} or extra \end{align}(x-8)^2 \\ \end{align}$$ Instead of manually FOILing it out, you just need to follow do this: $$\begin{gather} \\ \text{First, be sure to keep the b's sign the same when doubling it, weird I know!} \\ x^2\text{+/-}2(b)+b^2\\ \text{So the above would be:} \\ (x-8)^2 =x^2 -16+64 \end{gather} I need to add more aa if the last two digits are divisible by 4 then the whole thing is divisible by 4 11 * a number with 2 digits, add the two digits together and put it in the middle so for example 11 * 72 = 792! if it goes over 9 then you just roll it over 11 * 89 979 mjx-container[jax="SVG"] { direction: ltr; } mjx-container[jax="SVG"] > svg { overflow: visible; min-height: 1px; min-width: 1px; } mjx-container[jax="SVG"] > svg a { fill: blue; stroke: blue; } mjx-container[jax="SVG"][display="true"] { display: block; text-align: center; margin: 1em 0; } mjx-container[jax="SVG"][display="true"][width="full"] { display: flex; } mjx-container[jax="SVG"][justify="left"] { text-align: left; } mjx-container[jax="SVG"][justify="right"] { text-align: right; } g[data-mml-node="merror"] > g { fill: red; stroke: red; } g[data-mml-node="merror"] > rect[data-background] { fill: yellow; stroke: none; } g[data-mml-node="mtable"] > line[data-line], svg[data-table] > g > line[data-line] { stroke-width: 70px; fill: none; } g[data-mml-node="mtable"] > rect[data-frame], svg[data-table] > g > rect[data-frame] { stroke-width: 70px; fill: none; } g[data-mml-node="mtable"] > .
